title: Clinician for Physicians Associate Programme
text:
★ View Employer Profile 
Background The Institute of Medical Sciences is seeking to employ an enthusiastic, suitably qualified medical practitioner to act as the clinical lead in the development and delivery of a Post Graduate Diploma in Physicians Associate Studies to be launched at the University in the Spring of 2016. The Role 
This is a teaching intensive role that includes providing medical leadership in the teaching and assessing of medicine within the PA programme. 
The post will be based at the Medway Campus of the University and you will work with staff from the Institute of Medical Sciences and a project manager recruited by HEKSS. 
A PA is a new healthcare professional who, while not a doctor, works to the medical model, with the attitudes, skills and knowledge base to deliver holistic care and treatment within the general medical and/or general practice team under defined levels of supervision. 
Requirements 
This post represents a significant opportunity for a talented and ambitious person who has the ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders to make a significant contribution to educating the future medical workforce. 
The post holder will have responsibility to coordinate and support colleagues in the delivery of the medical elements of the programme. 
The candidate will be able to demonstrate commitment to the development of this new profession and provide inspirational medical leadership to help lead the programme through validation and initial delivery. 
In the first instance the role is a three year fixed term appointment but the opportunity presents for a suitable candidate to apply for a permanent full time position as the programme becomes established. 
You will be medically qualified with relevant educational / programme development experience. 
Additional Information 
This post is fixed term for three years, based at the Medway Campus. Discussions relating to a secondment are welcomed. 
Start date for applications: Thursday 17 September 2015 
Closing date for applications: Thursday 1 October 2015 
Interviews are to be held: TBC – shortly after the close date 
How to apply 
Please note, Canterbury Christ Church University reserve the right to bring the closing date of this position forward where a high volume of applications are received 
For posts of this nature you will be required to fill in the main details section as well as upload your CV and any supporting documents. 
For informal enquiries please contact Peter Milburn, Director of the Institute of Medical Sciences, on 01634 894400 or via email peter.milburn@canterbuy.ac.uk . 
If you require further information regarding the application process please contact the Recruitment Team at hr.recruitment@canterbury.ac.uk quoting reference number FHH0595. Please note applications must be made online via the University website; details sent directly via email cannot be considered. 
If you are invited for an interview, provided you give us your permission to do so, we may request references for you at that stage (before interview). Please ensure you include EMAIL contact details of two employment referees in your application, one of which must be your current/ most recent line manager. Share this job
